page.title: 01GORRAN - GENERAL
page.content: This is an area of great natural beauty - rugged cliffs, tiny coves and sandy beaches. From Great Perhaver Point past the harbour at Gorran Haven,along the coast to Dodman Pt.,which rises to 372 ft. and was once an Iron Age fort - earth ramparts and ancient tumuli are clearly visible. Along the coast and inland are scattered small farms. The National Trust owns much of the area, and several of the farms. The main population centre is Gorran Haven, once a small fishing village which has grown vastly over the past 25 years. Many holiday makers visit every year . The village has a garage, sub post-office, bakery, grocery. doctor's surgery, and two cafes. There is a tiny church and a Methodist Chapel.
